description: St. Jean de Paris Forest at Fontainebleau
marks: Signature LL in burnt sienna: [TH Rousseau.] (Needs lab exam
text:
This painting once belonged to James J. Hill (1838-1916), the Minnesota railroad magnate whose collection of European paintings forms the basis of the Institute's nineteenth-century holdings.

Recent conservation of this picture was made possible by a generous contribution from an anonymous patron.
title: Autumn at St. Jean de Paris, Forest of Fontainebleau
